snippet: The Treasury Department said the government ran a deficit of $176.7 billion for the first three months of this budget year, which began Oct. 1.
abstract: Treasury Dept reports federal deficit reached 176.7 billion in first quarter of budget year, up 2.4 percent from year-earlier period; rise reflects absence of special payment from Freddie Mac in 2014.
lead_paragraph: The Treasury Department said the government ran a deficit of $176.7 billion for the first three months of this budget year, which began Oct. 1.

headline.main: Federal Deficit Up Slightly in First Fiscal Quarter
headline.print_headline: Federal Deficit Up Slightly in First Fiscal Quarter
